definition: to drag (sb) along (to a place)/to yank
strong/powerful/better/slightly more than/vigorous/violent/best in their category, e.g. see 百強|百强[bai3 qiang2]
to force/to compel/to strive/to make an effort
to pull/to play (a bowed instrument)/to drag/to draw/to chat

sentences.english: On the way home, ping is a group of bad guy robbed, and is strong to pull out of the car.
sentences.chinese: 在回家的途中，萍被一群坏人抢劫，并被强拉下车。

sentences.english: There is a long history of companies pushing banks to stand behind their deals.
sentences.chinese: 公司强拉银行做后盾的历史由来已久。

definition: to drag sb along against his will/to draw a forced analogy
lit. to pull sb into the water/to involve sb in a messy business/to get sb into trouble
to cajole/to sweet talk sb into doing sth
gongs and drums overture to a Chinese opera/to create a disturbance
to tug at/to pull at sb aggressively/to take sb's hand or arm in a too familiar way/(derog.) to hobnob/to consort
to force oneself upon sb (idiom)/to rape
